name: Staybridge Suites Allentown Bethlehem Airport

reviews.text: We stayed here because of a promotion on the Holiday Inn priority club website offering this location for only 5,000 points. We live in the Lehigh Valley, but travel often and had returned early and did not want to intrude on family staying in our home. 5,000 points a night is really good for this hotel, and I am still not 100% positive that it was not some kind of mistake.
reviews.title: Cannot go wrong here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is just off 22 and very near the airport. Every room is a suite and they do a good job of making it seem very close to upscale. You cannot really swim this time of year since and we did not think we would get to swim, something our girsl always look forward to with hotel stays, since their pool is outdoor. However, we were pleasantly suprised that they have an arrangment with the Hilton Garden Inn next door for guests to use thier indoor pool. Very cool!
reviews.title: Nice Choice

reviews.text: Very spacious suites, nice kitchen area..Sort of everything you would expect. It's not fun knowing that your house is 3 miles away and you are in a hotel, but this turned out to be a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!

reviews.text: We were in town for a concert and decided we wanted a home-like base. The hotel staff was nice and attentive, and the rooms were clean and in excellent condition. The location was close to shops and a variety of restaurants. Continental breakfast was served every morning and offered plenty of tasty choices! Overall we enjoyed our stay very much.
reviews.title: Great place for family and group

reviews.text: The Staybridge Suites on Airport Road is wonderful! We stayed for 6 nights and are very impressed. We had a 2 room suite, which had a bedroom with a queen size bed and full bathroom. The other bedroom had 2 double beds and full bathroom. In addition there was a living room area and a small kitchenette. Breakfast is free in the mornings and the variety was excellent, with different hot items each morning. Also, on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday they offer a small dinner/snack in the evenings. All of the staff was very friendly and genuinely concerned about our comfort. The laundry room has four washers and five dryers and are free to use. The hotel was spotless from top to bottom and we will definately stay when in the Lehigh Valley next time. Lastly, they allowed us to have out 2 small dogs, which is hard to find places at a reasonable rate anymore.
reviews.title: Basic Suite Style Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed here several times while he was in town on business, but I never bothered to write a review before. This is a very nice place to stay for business or pleasure. The suites have kind beds in the bedrooms with large tv; full kitchens with full size fridge, stove, dish washer, microwave, sink, dishes, pots, pans and utencils; living room with pull out couch, TV etc. Tuesday-Thrusday evenings they offer an evening buffet of snacks like fish and chicken nuggest, sandwiches, mini bagel-pizzas, fresh veggies and dip, chips, salsa, soft drinks; and daily breakfast includes eggs, meat, croissants, bagels, muffins, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, cheese, juice, and more. The food is good, plentiful and the staff keeps it fresh. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The convience store has many snacks and fast cooking meal options (though not much for vegetarians, so be warned). The fitness center is adequate and clean, with a hot tub which looks very nice, though we haven't tried it. The business center had 2 computers, so less likely to have to wait if another guest beat you to it, assorted fiction books and board games to borrow. This is a nice place for a family, especially if you have small children. There are restaurants within walking distance for lunch and dinner, and many more within driving distance. Even a health food eatery in the near by strip mall, which I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay.

likes.liked: — THe size of the accomodations, the multi-room suites and the breakfast and evening buffets.

reviews.text: I really loved this hotel. My daughter had a softball tournament in the area, and we stayed here. Everything was very clean. The employess were friendly. We had no complaints..Would stay here again and tell others to stay here.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel
Incredible Hotel!!!
reviews.text: What an absolutly wonderful experience. I was relocating to the area and found everything I needed right at my fingertips. The staff was extremly helpful and knowledgable about the area. For being in a new area they made be feel right at home. THEY ARE PET FRIENDLY AS WELL!!

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
reviews.text: The Staybridge Suites was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great and the hotel is located close to attractions and restaurants. I would stay here again anytime. Be careful when finding driving directions through Yahoo or Mapquest as for some reason, they take you to a Quality Inn down the road from the Staybridge Suites and it is not such a nice place.
A+++ Experience. Kid friendly.
reviews.title: This is a great place

reviews.text: The rooms at this hotel are typical of the Staybridge Suites brand. Clean, large, and unremarkable. The breakfast was fine but the food that was served at happy hour was disappointing. The front desk was often unattended, with a bell to summon an employee from the back office. I found this surprising both in terms of welcoming guests and in providing some semblance of security.
reviews.title: Convenient to airport, good breakfast, mediocre happy hour

reviews.text: We booked a large suite for our family (mom, dad, child, and grandma) for a recent Saturday night. The suite was well layed out, with 2 separate bedrooms each with its own bathroom, with a pull out bed in the "living room", and a fully equipped kitchen area. The price was very reasonable. Theoretically, the suite was perfect for us, privacy for all. The problem is that other guests use their kitchens to the fullest, meaning that cooking aromas abound. We came back to the room for the evening, and the hallway absolutely stunk of onions. The smeall permeated our suite, making it very uncomfortable. I asked the front desk if something could be done about the onion smell, and the clerk gave me a can of Febreeze. I asked if cooking onions was really allowed. The reply was "oh yes, most definitely, sometimes the whole area even smells of curry". So, if you like to cook on your vacation, or find that cooking is more economical than eating out, this is the place for you. However, if you are expecting a pleasant odorless stay, ask for a room without a kitchen.
reviews.title: Staybridge Tenement?

reviews.text: The free breakfast was very good, with hot and cold choices.
reviews.title: Comfortable, affordable suite hotel

reviews.text: The outdoor pool was very pleasant, until a guest started up the grill. You guessed it-cooking aromas. I suppose if this was a neighborhood backyard, it would be great. But, we weren't expecting this.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Home away from Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable. However, you could hear your upstairs neighbors walking overhead.
reviews.title: excellent hotel and location

reviews.text: I am just now finishing up a 5-night stay at the Staybridge Allentown Airport. I had last stayed here two years ago. The property continues to be excellently maintained, and the furniture in my one bedroom suite appeared quite new.
reviews.title: Another great stay!

reviews.text: My suite was extremely clean and fresh-smelling, and the kitchen was well-equipped. I found the bed to be very comfortable, and everything in the suite worked well. There is only one drawback to this property: the air-conditioning unit blows extremely hard and is very loud. We had extremely hot weather while I was here, and the air conditioning definitely kept the suite cool, but the noise can grate on the nerves after awhile.
reviews.title: nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the outdoor pool just can't be beat - it's large and very clean, with lots of chairs around it. I enjoyed it 3 times during my stay. Really one of the best pools at this type of place.
reviews.title: Not our first choice but still great!

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this property again if I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The Staybridge was very clean and the people working the check in desk were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: comfortable and spacious
Great Place To Stay
reviews.text: Customer service is outstanding. Our room was a suite with one bedroom, kitchen (full size refrigerator, microwave, stove top, utensils, cups, plates, etc.) living room area with fold out sofa/bed, two televisions, two phones, and nice bathroom with separate vanity/sink area. Complimentary buffet breakfast, which includes eggs and bacon or sausage, muffins, pastry, cereal, etc. They also offer a packaged breakfast to go. They have a laundry room with four washers and four dryers, open 24 hours a day, free of charge. If you book your room in advance, you can a great deal. Highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay!!!!
reviews.text: I found this hotel, lobby area and suite, to be very clean and modern. The staff were very cordial and made my stay wonderful! It is a very family oriented hotel and great for extended stay with the kitchens in every suite. This is one of the best places I have ever stayed.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Allentown several times and have been very pleased with the hotel. There is room for improvement (hot water & water pressure) but they try *much* harder than most to please. It's clean and quiet. The rooms, lobby and gathering area are clean and pleasant. While there's no restaurant in the hotel there's one within walking distance.

This hotel is supurb! The hotel staff is wonderful! The rooms are spacious with lots of natural light! I would definetly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure! Full fridge, comfortable beds, dishwaher , spotless hotel & rooms, walking disstance to a Target, stip mall, & many resturaunts! I can not thank them enough for the wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Typical Staybridge

reviews.text: This is a great hotel to stay at for a park and fly if your leaving out of Lehigh Valley Airport or if you are visiting the area for any reason. The rooms are clean, roomy, fully equipped w/ kitchens, great outdoor pool area with 2 large gas grills and an indoor hot tub (which unfortunately was not working while we were there) and fitness center.
reviews.title: Great place. Would definately stay again!

reviews.text: I had a horrible experience with a hotel and thankfully this hotel was in a very close proximity. It was a little more expensive then what we normally like to pay, but you get what you pay for. This hotel was definitely worth the money, and I was quite happy with the room. They also are a pet friendly hotel, although they do ask for an extra pet fee. When I checked into the hotel I was having a problem with my credit cards. I was traveling so much I had a block I needed to remove from my credit card and authenticate that the cards were mine and not stolen since i was making so many hotel purchases on it. The first guy at the desk was a jerk and wouldn't help me with crap. So thats why I left and then came back exasperated about how gross the other hotels around this place were. I came back and said I didn't care if there was an extra charge I would pay the extra I just needed to spend the night somewhere clean. Talk about night and day. This hotel was immaculate, and I felt safe there. The second guy was much more efficient and he checked me in without any hassles. He even didn't charge me an extra fee for paying in cash. The room was clean with a full refrigerator, and stove. There was a lot of room in this spacious suite. It was very clean and looked really nice. I was happy that i didn't have to deal with any issues and that the room was nice. They have a 24 hour gym there with really nice equipment. I ran with no problem in the gym and the treadmill was state of the art with tv's connected to them, though without headphones you can't hear the tv on the treadmill, unless you turn on the tv behind you and watch the screen on your treadmill which I did and it worked out nice. There is also a 24 hour business office, and you can do your laundry right there on site. They have a nice hot tub which looked gorgeous and inviting open till 2am. The pool was closed because it was past the hours of operation but it was nice too. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and wouldn't think twice about staying at this hotel again. The beds were really soft and nice as well. I am used to a king sized bed, and this was a queen, but it didn't matter because it was so comfortable.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I chose this hotel only because we were "flying" (actually a bus to Newark, NJ Airport with a Continental flight number. But that's another story) out of the Allentown-Bethlehem Airport on an extended trip and Staybridge Suites offered us 4 weeks of "Park, Sleep, Fly" free parking. The free parking worked out great for us. But over and above that we found the on-demand airport shuttle service to be very efficient, the front desk to be very helpful, the included breakfast to be perfectly adequate and the suite itself to be clean, spacious and comfortable. While we don't generally go out of our way to choose chain hotels, this was an excellent experience and I have nothing at all bad to say about it.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations and Value

reviews.text: Your choice of wonderful hot or cold breakfast at the buffet and usually brought back to the room. We had 5 people, but I would suggest only 4 in a suite to be totally comfortable.
reviews.title: We loved the price, breakfast and suite

reviews.text: It was a great time to visit with family from California, Georgia and Florida. I would stay there again in a heart beat, sharing the price of the room.
reviews.title: Perfect stay, almost

reviews.text: I want to start out by saying this was the second time we had stayed here and it is a wonderful hotel. Check in was a breeze and we went right up to our suite. It was nicely appointed, clean and suited our group perfectly. All of the kitchen supplies were in great shape and we loved being able to use the grill as well. We were very pleased with the sundowner reception as well as the fully stocked breakfast.
reviews.title: It's a smoking room we made non-smoking for today,,,,,,,

reviews.text: We're a family of 5 (plus a small dog). This hotel had two bedrooms, living room, kitchen, 3 TV's and they allowed dogs - extra charge. They gave us a room near an exit for dog walks, etc. Located close to Dorney Park, a short ride on the highway and they gave us discount tickets. They also had free breakfast. A great value and a nice, clean hotel. We had a great time and plan on going back!
reviews.title: Great Location for Dorney Trip

reviews.text: The price was reasonable and the accomodations were great. The complimentary breakfast was the best I've ever had at a hotel - even fresh waffles!
reviews.title: Great place to stay and reasonable

likes.disliked: — near Iron Pigs stadium and we could hear the fireworks

reviews.text: A group of us stayed at this hotel for the weekend. The rooms and features were fine, nothing to complain about, until a smoke alarm starts going off in our room. We all ran to the front desk to tell them that everything was ok and heard a security guard yell over the loudspeaker, "It was room one-hunnies, you know the [--] room". This was also yelled in front of other guests. We were furious and spoke to management who said there was nothing they could do about this prejudiced behavior. Upon leaving the hotel(which we left a mess) I called their corporate offices to complain and received a call from a district manager who said he would investigate the incident. A few weeks later he calls and informs me that there is nothing they can do and the employees denied everything. I was told that he would "try" to get a free weekend for us, and I never heard back from them. BEWARE of this hotel as their employees and management have no problems discriminating against people and their corporate office will stick up for their employees. Where are the days when the customer was always right??? Definitely not at Staybridge Suites or any Holiday Inn!
reviews.title: Beware of this hotel

likes.disliked: — derogatory comments made by hotel employees and management

reviews.title: wonderful place to stay; S Baker, Camden East, Ontario
reviews.text: After reading the great reviews, my husband and I stayed for 3 days (April 19-22, 2007). We had a king one bedroom and it was very nicely laid out. It was spotless and provided us with all the amenities for in house cooking. The bed was very comfortable and each day we returned to find the suite looking as if we had just checked in. The only thing we could find wrong was with the breakfast....not that there wasn't enough choice...there was a wonderful selection...however the hot food was not very warm. It did not prove to be a real problem as we took our food back to the suite and warmed it in the microwave..so problem solved. We would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for ultimate comfort.

My husband, daughter, and myself stayed at this hotel from 11/24/06 to 11/26/06. The other reviews are pretty accurate. This is a nice hotel to stay in. Check-in/check-out was quick and easy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room, bathroom, sheets and towels were all very clean. We had a king suite. The bed was comfortable. The sofabed was comfortable for my daughter. The hotel was quiet. We did not eat the breakfast, but did go down one morning to check out the selection. The presentation was nice. The usual items that you would expect were offered: Bagels, muffins, fruit, yogurt, cold cereal, oatmeal, fruit, coffee, tea, milk. There were also silver dollar pancakes and sausage on that particular day. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Good Place To Stay

description: Welcome to the Staybridge Suites Allentown Airport Hotel. The Staybridge Suites Allentown Airport hotel is a member of the IHG family of brands, which includes InterContinental, Crowne Plaza, Hotel Indigo, Holiday Inn and Candlewood Suites. The Staybridge Suites hotel offers apartment like suites to government, business, relocation, training and extended stay hotel guests requiring long or short term hotel or real estate accommodations. The Staybridge Suites Hotel Allentown Airport is within walking distance to dining, shopping & entertainment. We are in near proximity to major Lehigh Valley businesses including B Braun, FL Smidth, Bosch Rexroth, Olympus America, LSI, Air Products, Crayola, Dun & Bradstreet, Lutron, Mack Trucks, PPL & OraSure. We are located within a few minutes drive to Lehigh Valley attractions including Dorney Park & Wild Water Kingdom, Crayola Factory, Blue Mountain Ski Area, Historic Downtown Bethlehem & Coca Cola Park Iron Pigs Baseball. Our pet friendly hotel (fee) offers studio, one-bedroom and two-bedroom apartment like suites featuring fully-equipped kitchens, spacious living and work areas, TV w/in-room movies, HBO, free high-speed Internet access & dual phones with personalized voice mail. Other apartment like conveniences include 24 hour business center w/ free Internet access, print, fax and copy capabilities, complimentary guest laundry facilities, fitness center, courtyard, BBQ Pavilion and Outdoor Pool (seasonal).
